Uses of Class
GameModel.Character

  • Packages that use Character 
    Package Description
    GameModel  
    GameModel.mobs  

    • Uses of Character in GameModel

      Subclasses of Character in GameModel 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Player
      Player is a subclass of Character, it is the Character type that is controllable by the user during his time in the Mud Game.
      Methods in GameModel that return Character 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Character Area.hasCharacter(java.lang.String characterName)
      Check if an Area contains a Character.
      Methods in GameModel that return types with arguments of type Character 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<Character> Area.getOccupants()
      Get all of the occupants inside of the Area.
      Methods in GameModel with parameters of type Character 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean World.addCharacter(Character ch)
      Adds a Character object to the World, at the location specified in the Character.
      void Character.addNeighbor(Character c)
      Adds a Character to this Character's map of neighbors and sets the starting distance at 2
      void Area.addOccupant(Character ch)
      Add a Character to the Area.
      void World.advance(Character mover, Character target)
      Advances the character towards the target.
      void World.attack(Character attacker, Character defender)
      Starts combat between the attacker and the defender.
      int Character.closerTo(Character c, int unitsCloser)
      Moves the passed Character a number of units closer to this Character on his map of neighbors
      boolean Area.containsCharacter(Character ch)
      Check whether or not the Area has a Character.
      int Character.distanceFrom(Character c)
      Returns the distance between this Character and the one passed
      int Character.furtherFrom(Character c, int unitsFurther)
      Moves the passed Character a number of units further from this Character on his map of neighbors
      java.util.Iterator<Player> Area.getAllPlayersExcept(Character ch1)
      Get all of the Players inside of the room except the passed in Character.
      java.util.Iterator<Player> Area.getAllPlayersExcept(Character ch1, Character ch2)
      Get all of the Players inside of the room except the passed in Characters.
      java.lang.String Area.getDescription(Character character)
      Get the Description of the room.
      java.lang.String World.moveCharacter(Character ch, Direction dir)
      Checks the passed direction for exits, locked exits, and the possibility of going out of bounds.
      void Character.removeNeighbor(Character c)
      Removes a Character from this Character's map of neighbors
      boolean Area.removeOccupant(Character ch)
      Remove an occupant from this Area.
      void World.retreat(Character mover, Character target)
      Moves the character mover one space away from the character target.
      void World.say(Character ch, java.lang.String message, boolean isSocial)
      Says the message to character ch's client as a notification, as well as anyone in the same room as ch.

    • Uses of Character in GameModel.mobs

      Subclasses of Character in GameModel.mobs 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BabySpider
      This is a smaller version of the Giant Spider, just as aggressive but slightly slower and less powerful It advances on it's target 2 spaces at a time if necessary.
      class  Dragon
      Final boss of the game.
      class  GiantRat
      The weakest MOB in the game.
      class  GiantSpider
      This is an aggressive and powerful mob which will attack and move very quickly.
      class  Goblin
      Annoying monster.
      class  GoblinShaman
      Same damage resistance as goblin, slightly less health.
      class  Grue
      From Zork: "The grue is a sinister, lurking presence in the dark places of the earth.
      class  Imp
      Tiny, mischievious creature.
      class  Mob
      Mob is Character and implement runnable.
      class  SkeletonArcher
      Works the same as skeleton warrior, but damage equal to longbow instead of iron sword.
      class  SkeletonWarrior
      Fairly brittle, so low health.
      class  Troll
      Massive, slow-moving, stupid brute with a club.
